description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Our mission is to develop Google Customer Solutions (GCS) product and go-to-market strategy to support the growth of Lead Generations (Lead Gen) advertisers,.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience working with diverse cross functional teams in a matrixed environment.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years in sales, marketing, strategic consulting, or similar role (e.g. sales ops, sales finance, program management, etc.)
  • Strategic thinking with demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives; distinctive problem solving and analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment.
  • Excellent communication skills; confidence in presenting solutions to senior-level audiences and communicating with highly technical management and product teams.
  • Demonstrated ability to work, collaborate and influence cross-functionally. Ability to set a goal and vision for virtual team and translate this into tactical quarterly goals.
responsibilities:
• Lead cross functional teams to execute against strategy with high bar for operational excellence
  • Partner with Sales, Product, Strategy and Operations and Support teams globally to identify, prioritize and deliver key improvements in serving Lead Gen advertisers across ad formats, automation, measurement, analytics and support. Create proposals that demonstrate why these needs are critical and be a key influencer to product and support roadmap
  • Work with regional sales teams to develop and execute product go-to-market and sales enablement plans for Lead Gen marketing solutions
  • Define and track success metrics, including product adoption targets, health indicators, sales activity/behavior; develop and refine best practices and collateral
title: Global Product Lead, Lead Generation, Google Customer Solutions
